did.abstract: Debriefing report and diary of Anton Russell, private in the 339th Infantry Medical Detachment, sent to Archangel, Russia at the end of World War I, the "Polar Bear Expedition."

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Roy H. Russell in 2011 (Donor no.: 10574).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box no., Anton Russell papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Anton Russell served as a private with the 339th Infantry Medical Detachment, sent to Archangel, Russia at the end of World War I, the Polar Bear Expedition.

scopecontent.p: This collection contains original materials and digital reproductions. The digital items in this collection were digitized from originals by the individual donors before being received by the Bentley Historical Library. Preservation copies of these files with their original file names and CD-ROM file structures intact have been submitted to Deep Blue. Access copies of these digital files can be viewed by clicking on the links next to the individual folders in the Content List below.

In this finding aid, the files have been arranged into one series, Papers. Within each series, files are listed numerically according to the file arrangement they were given by the donor. The files in this collection are in TIF format.
Includes files containing the digitized diary, or travel log, of Russell's service and a Polar Bear reunion medal; also a non-digitized transcribed copy of a debriefing report.

controlaccess.head: Subjects
controlaccess.corpname: United States. Army. Infantry, 339th. Medical Detachment.
controlaccess.subject: World War, 1914-1918.
Polar Bear Expedition.

did.unittitle: Travel log, July 14, 1918-July 12, 1919 and Polar Bear reunion medal, 1922

note.p: (Note: The 34 TIF files that make up the Travel log have been converted to 1 PDF, and the 1 TIF image of the medal has been converted to a JPG for the Access Site.)
